titleStmt.title: R. J. Moseley et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5497

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: We the undersigned citizens of Ohio County Ky. would would respectfully represent to his Excellency Thomas E. Bramlett Govenor of Ky. That at the March Term 1864 of the Ohio Circuit Court there was three judgments obtained by the Commonwealth against James W. Daniel.

viz= For permitting gaming in his hourse fine $75- and costs. Breach of tavern bond $150- & cost, Permitting gaming on his premises $75- & costs, one half of said judgments have been remitted by your honor. That said Daniel has paid all the costs in the prosecutions, including attorneys 30 percent. That we are well acquainted with said Daniel and know him to be a very poor man. having but very little property if any at all and a large family to support. that if he is made to pay the fine he will be entirely broken up and his family brought to want. That he lives in a very poor portion of the County and may possibly have been guilty as charged, but if guilty we believe he was ignorant of the fact. that he did not violate the law intentionally. We would now respectfully request that you remit the remainder of the judgmetns.

R J moseley clk O. C. C.
Zane K. Cox D. C.
H. L. Morton Clk Ohio Cir Ct
HARTFORD
MAY
8
KY.

Thomas E. Bramlett Govenor of Ky
Frankfort
Kentucky

Refused
Ohio Cir Ct
vs
Jas W. Daniel
